channel.title: Remove disks or other media
channel.description:
Hello, I followed a tutorial to make a bootable USB, and everything went smooth until I tried loading the OS. Once I get to the grub screen and pick the linux partition, I get this error: Remove disks or other media Press any key to restart
Here is my menu.lst [I use wingrub]:
timeout 30
title OSNAME at (hd0,0) unhide (hd0,0) rootnoverify (hd0,0) chainloader +1 makeactive boot
title Windows at (hd1,0) unhide (hd1,0) rootnoverify (hd1,0) chainloader +1 makeactive boot
I took out the OS name for no reason, I just do not want to post it. Anyways, can anyone help? Also, the windows partition loads just fine. Thanks Justis

item.title: Remove disks or other media
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Thank you for your help, but unfortunately the package came without a kernel so I am just going to use a different distro.

Read full topic

item.title: Remove disks or other media
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

you forgot the kernel line(s) for OSNAME, a typical linux boot config looks like this:

title Gentoo Linux 2.6.23-r8 root (hd0,0) kernel /boot/kernel-2.6.23-gentoo-r8 root=/dev/hda3

Read full topic

item.title: Remove disks or other media
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Hello,
I followed a tutorial to make a bootable USB, and everything went smooth until I tried loading the OS.
Once I get to the grub screen and pick the linux partition, I get this error:
Remove disks or other media
Press any key to restart

Here is my menu.lst [I use wingrub]:

timeout 30

title OSNAME at (hd0,0)
unhide (hd0,0)
rootnoverify (hd0,0)
chainloader +1
makeactive
boot

title Windows at (hd1,0)
unhide (hd1,0)
rootnoverify (hd1,0)
chainloader +1
makeactive
boot

I took out the OS name for no reason, I just do not want to post it.
Anyways, can anyone help? Also, the windows partition loads just fine.
Thanks
Justis

Read full topic
